intro: Triodia figueirae, commonly known as the Figueira triodia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance through its deep root system and reduced leaf surface. Triodia figueirae plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native fauna in its native range.
